summary: The FIREWALL Act amends the Internal Revenue Code to offer a refundable tax credit for disaster mitigation expenditures. Homeowners in areas that have experienced recent wildfires, hurricanes, windstorms, or floods can receive a credit equal to 50% of qualified expenses, up to $25,000 (with phase-out for high earners and limitations for jointly occupied dwellings). Qualified expenditures include various home improvements and installations designed to increase resilience against natural disasters. The bill also includes provisions for inflation adjustments and documentation requirements.
